channel.title: Comments on: Domino Dojo Discussion Database

item.title: By: Matt White
item.dc:creator: Matt White
item.description: <p>Jack,<br /><br />I've looked at EXT but only as a bystander. Both yours and Jake's work looks very interesting. But unfortunately I only have time to dedicate to one of the big frameworks and I'm sold on Dojo!<br /><br />I hope that over time there is a consolidation of these semi-official frameworks, or at least some natural coming together of the APIs. There's just so much to learn and so little time.<br /><br />Matt</p>
item.content:encoded:
Jack,

I’ve looked at EXT but only as a bystander. Both yours and Jake’s work looks very interesting. But unfortunately I only have time to dedicate to one of the big frameworks and I’m sold on Dojo!

I hope that over time there is a consolidation of these semi-official frameworks, or at least some natural coming together of the APIs. There’s just so much to learn and so little time.

Matt

item.title: By: Jack Ratcliff
item.dc:creator: Jack Ratcliff
item.description: <p>What are your thoughts on Ext? I've been using it for a while now and the grid and tree widget seem perfect for domino views and outlines.<br /><br />Here's a demo of a domino app integrated with Ext.<br /><br />{ <a href="<a rel="nofollow" href="http://jackratcliff.com/jratcliff/dwt/dwt-demo.nsf/main.html"" rel="nofollow ugc">http://jackratcliff.com/jratcliff/dwt/dwt-demo.nsf/main.html"</a> rel="nofollow" target ="blank">Link</a> }<br /><br />It does sound like IBM is going to be using Dojo with Domino in the near future. However, I think I'm going to stick with Ext + Domino. <img alt="Emoticon" src="<a rel="nofollow ugc">http://www.11tmr.com/11tmr.nsf/emoticons/DLYH-5MZVLY/$File/smile.gif"</a> /> </p>
item.content:encoded:
What are your thoughts on Ext? I’ve been using it for a while now and the grid and tree widget seem perfect for domino views and outlines.

Here’s a demo of a domino app integrated with Ext.

{ http://jackratcliff.com/jratcliff/dwt/dwt-demo.nsf/main.html“ rel=”nofollow” target =”blank”>Link }

It does sound like IBM is going to be using Dojo with Domino in the near future. However, I think I’m going to stick with Ext + Domino. http://www.11tmr.com/11tmr.nsf/emoticons/DLYH-5MZVLY/$File/smile.gif“ />

item.title: By: Patrick Kwinten
item.dc:creator: Patrick Kwinten
item.description: <p>Hej!<br/><br /><br/><br />Thank you for the posting. I was just collecting information how to integrate Dojo into Domino applications and your posting is excellent for this little research.<br/><br /><br/><br />Keep up the good work!<br/><br /><img alt="Emoticon" src="<a rel="nofollow ugc">http://www.11tmr.com/11tmr.nsf/emoticons/DLYH-5MZVLY/$File/smile.gif"</a> /> </p>
item.content:encoded:
Hej!

Thank you for the posting. I was just collecting information how to integrate Dojo into Domino applications and your posting is excellent for this little research.

Keep up the good work!

http://www.11tmr.com/11tmr.nsf/emoticons/DLYH-5MZVLY/$File/smile.gif“ />
